# SomaDataIO

The `SomaDataIO` R package loads and exports ‘SomaScan’ data via the
SomaLogic Operating Co., Inc. structured text file called an ADAT
(`*.adat`). The package also exports auxiliary functions for
manipulating, wrangling, and extracting relevant information from an
ADAT object once in memory. Basic familiarity with the R environment is
assumed, as is the ability to install contributed packages from the
Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN).

If you run into any issues/problems with `SomaDataIO` full documentation
of the most recent
[release](https://github.com/SomaLogic/SomaDataIO/releases) can be found
at our [website of articles and
workflows](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/). If the issue
persists we encourage you to consult the
[issues](https://github.com/SomaLogic/SomaDataIO/issues/) page and, if
appropriate, submit an issue and/or feature request.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Usage

The `SomaDataIO` package is licensed under the
[MIT](https://github.com/SomaLogic/SomaDataIO/blob/main/LICENSE.md)
license and is intended solely for research use only (“RUO”) purposes.
The code contained herein may *not* be used for diagnostic, clinical,
therapeutic, or other commercial purposes.

## Installation

The easiest way to install `SomaDataIO` is to install directly from
CRAN:

``` r
install.packages("SomaDataIO")
```

Alternatively from GitHub:

``` r
remotes::install_github("SomaLogic/SomaDataIO")
```

which installs the most current “development” version from the
repository `HEAD`. To install the *most recent* release, use:

``` r
remotes::install_github("SomaLogic/SomaDataIO@*release")
```

To install a *specific* tagged release, use:

``` r
remotes::install_github("SomaLogic/SomaDataIO@v5.3.0")
```

#### Package Dependencies

The `SomaDataIO` package was intentionally developed to contain a
limited number of dependencies from CRAN. This makes the package more
stable to external software design changes but also limits its contained
feature set. With this in mind, `SomaDataIO` aims to strike a balance
providing long(er)-term stability and a limited set of features. Below
are the package dependencies (see also the
[DESCRIPTION](https://github.com/SomaLogic/SomaDataIO/blob/main/DESCRIPTION)
file):

- [R (\>= 4.1.0)](https://cran.r-project.org/)
- [cli](https://cran.r-project.org/package=cli)
- [dplyr](https://cran.r-project.org/package=dplyr)
- [ggplot2](https://cran.r-project.org/package=ggplot2)
- [lifecycle](https://cran.r-project.org/package=lifecycle)
- [magrittr](https://cran.r-project.org/package=magrittr)
- [readxl](https://cran.r-project.org/package=readxl)
- [tibble](https://cran.r-project.org/package=tibble)
- [tidyr](https://cran.r-project.org/package=tidyr)

#### Biobase

The `Biobase` package is *suggested*, being required by only two
functions,
[`pivotExpressionSet()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/pivotExpressionSet.md)
and
[`adat2eSet()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat2eSet.md).
[Biobase](https://www.bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Biobase.html)
must be installed separately from
[Bioconductor](https://www.bioconductor.org) by entering the following
from the `R` Console:

``` r
if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("BiocManager")
}
BiocManager::install("Biobase", version = remotes::bioc_version())
```

Information about Bioconductor can be found here:
<https://bioconductor.org/install/>

#### Loading

Upon *successful* installation, load `SomaDataIO` as normal:

``` r
library(SomaDataIO)
```

For an index of available commands:

``` r
library(help = SomaDataIO)
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Objects and Data

The `SomaDataIO` package comes with five (5) objects available to users
to run canned examples (or analyses). They can be accessed once
`SomaDataIO` has been attached via
[`library()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/library.html). They are:

- `example_data`: the original ‘SomaScan’ file (`example_data.adat`) can
  be found [here](https://github.com/SomaLogic/SomaLogic-Data) or
  downloaded directly via:

  ``` bash
  wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SomaLogic/SomaLogic-Data/main/example_data.adat
  ```

  - within `SomaDataIO` it has been replaced by an abbreviated,
    light-weight version containing only the first 10 samples:

    ``` r
    dir(system.file("extdata", package = "SomaDataIO"), full.names = TRUE)
    ```

- `ex_analytes`: the analyte (feature) variables in `example_data`

- `ex_anno_tbl`: the annotations table associated with `example_data`

- `ex_target_names`: a mapping object for analyte -\> target

- `ex_clin_data`: a table containing variables `SampleId`,
  `smoking_status` and `alcohol_use` to demonstrate merging clinical
  sample annotation information to a `soma_adat` object

- See also
  [`?SomaScanObjects`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaScanObjects.md)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Main (I/O) Features

- Loading data (Import)
  - parse and import a `*.adat` text file into an `R` session as a
    `soma_adat` object.
- Wrangling data (manipulation)
  - subset, reorder, and list various fields of a `soma_adat` object.
  - [`?SeqId`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
    analyte (feature) matching.
  - [dplyr](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org) and
    [tidyr](https://tidyr.tidyverse.org) verb S3 methods for the
    `soma_adat` class.
  - [`?rownames`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/rownames.md)
    helpers that do not break `soma_adat` attributes.
  - please see the article [Loading and Wrangling
    ‘SomaScan’](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/tips-loading-and-wrangling.html)
- Exporting data (Output)
  - write out a `soma_adat` object as a `*.adat` text file.

## Loading an ADAT

Loading an ADAT text file is simple using
[`read_adat()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/read_adat.md):

``` r
# Note: This `system.file()` command returns a filepath to the `example_data10` 
# object in the `SomaDataIO` package
adat_path <- system.file("extdata", "example_data10.adat",
                         package = "SomaDataIO", mustWork = TRUE)
adat_path
#> [1] "/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.5-x86_64/Resources/library/SomaDataIO/extdata/example_data10.adat"

# `adat_path` should be the elaborated path and file name of the *.adat file to
# be loaded into the R workspace from your local file system
# (e.g. adat_path = "PATH_TO_ADAT/my_adat.adat")
my_adat <- read_adat(file = adat_path)

# test object class
is.soma_adat(my_adat)
#> [1] TRUE

# S3 print method (forwards -> tibble)
my_adat
#> ══ SomaScan Data ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
#>      SomaScan version     V4 (5k)
#>      Signal Space         5k
#>      Attributes intact    ✓
#>      Rows                 10
#>      Columns              5318
#>      Clinical Data        34
#>      Features             5284
#> ── Column Meta ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> ℹ SeqId, SeqIdVersion, SomaId, TargetFullName, Target, UniProt, EntrezGeneID,
#> ℹ EntrezGeneSymbol, Organism, Units, Type, Dilution, PlateScale_Reference,
#> ℹ CalReference, Cal_Example_Adat_Set001, ColCheck,
#> ℹ CalQcRatio_Example_Adat_Set001_170255, QcReference_170255,
#> ℹ Cal_Example_Adat_Set002, CalQcRatio_Example_Adat_Set002_170255, Dilution2
#> ── Tibble ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> # A tibble: 10 × 5,319
#>    row_names      PlateId  PlateRunDate ScannerID PlatePosition SlideId Subarray
#>    <chr>          <chr>    <chr>        <chr>     <chr>           <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 258495800012_3 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H9            2.58e11        3
#>  2 258495800004_7 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H8            2.58e11        7
#>  3 258495800010_8 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H7            2.58e11        8
#>  4 258495800003_4 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H6            2.58e11        4
#>  5 258495800009_4 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H5            2.58e11        4
#>  6 258495800012_8 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H4            2.58e11        8
#>  7 258495800001_3 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H3            2.58e11        3
#>  8 258495800004_8 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H2            2.58e11        8
#>  9 258495800001_8 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H12           2.58e11        8
#> 10 258495800004_3 Example… 2020-06-18   SG152144… H11           2.58e11        3
#> # ℹ 5,312 more variables: SampleId <chr>, SampleType <chr>,
#> #   PercentDilution <int>, SampleMatrix <chr>, Barcode <lgl>, Barcode2d <chr>,
#> #   SampleName <lgl>, SampleNotes <lgl>, AliquotingNotes <lgl>,
#> #   SampleDescription <chr>, …
#> ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

Please see the article [Loading and Wrangling
SomaScan](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/tips-loading-and-wrangling.html)
for more details and options.

## Wrangling

The `soma_adat` class comes with numerous class-specific S3 methods to
the most popular [dplyr](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org) and
[tidyr](https://tidyr.tidyverse.org) generics.

``` r
# see full complement of `soma_adat` methods
methods(class = "soma_adat")
#>  [1] [              [[             [[<-           [<-            ==            
#>  [6] $              $<-            anti_join      arrange        count         
#> [11] filter         full_join      getAdatVersion getAnalytes    getMeta       
#> [16] group_by       inner_join     is_seqFormat   left_join      Math          
#> [21] median         merge          mutate         Ops            print         
#> [26] rename         right_join     row.names<-    sample_frac    sample_n      
#> [31] semi_join      separate       slice_sample   slice          summary       
#> [36] Summary        transform      ungroup        unite         
#> see '?methods' for accessing help and source code
```

#### Merging Sample Annotation Data

The `example_data` object includes some sample annotation data built-in,
with the variables `Age` and `Sex` included for clinical samples, but in
practice ADAT files generally do not have any clinical or sample
annotation data fields included.

To merge sample annotation data into an existing `soma_adat` class
object, use the
[`left_join()`](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/reference/mutate-joins.html)
method. Here, joining the `ex_clin_data` object adds in two additional
clinical variables, `smoking_status` and `alcohol_use`:

``` r
# `clin_path` should be the elaborated path and file name of the *.csv or
# similar file to be loaded into the R workspace from your local file system
# (e.g. clin_path = "PATH_TO_CLIN/clin_data.csv")
# clin_data <- readr::read_csv(clin_path)

merged_adat <- my_adat |> 
  dplyr::left_join(ex_clin_data, by = "SampleId") 

merged_adat |> 
  dplyr::select(SampleId, Age, Sex, smoking_status, alcohol_use) |> 
  head(n = 3)
#> ══ SomaScan Data ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
#>      SomaScan version     V4 (5k)
#>      Signal Space         5k
#>      Attributes intact    ✓
#>      Rows                 3
#>      Columns              5
#>      Clinical Data        5
#>      Features             0
#> ── Column Meta ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> ℹ SeqId, SeqIdVersion, SomaId, TargetFullName, Target, UniProt, EntrezGeneID,
#> ℹ EntrezGeneSymbol, Organism, Units, Type, Dilution, PlateScale_Reference,
#> ℹ CalReference, Cal_Example_Adat_Set001, ColCheck,
#> ℹ CalQcRatio_Example_Adat_Set001_170255, QcReference_170255,
#> ℹ Cal_Example_Adat_Set002, CalQcRatio_Example_Adat_Set002_170255, Dilution2
#> ── Tibble ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> # A tibble: 3 × 6
#>   row_names      SampleId   Age Sex   smoking_status alcohol_use
#>   <chr>          <chr>    <int> <chr> <chr>          <chr>      
#> 1 258495800012_3 1           76 F     Never          Yes        
#> 2 258495800004_7 2           55 F     Never          Yes        
#> 3 258495800010_8 3           47 M     Never          No         
#> ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

Please see the article [Loading and Wrangling
SomaScan](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/tips-loading-and-wrangling.html)
for more details about available `soma_adat` methods.

## ADAT structure

The `soma_adat` object also contains specific structure that are useful
to users. Please also see
[`?colmeta`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/Col.Meta.md)
or
[`?annotations`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/Col.Meta.md)
for further details about these fields.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Typical ‘SomaScan’ Analysis

This section now lives in individual package articles. For further
detail please see:

- Two-group comparison (e.g. differential expression) via *t*-test
  - see [`stats::t.test()`](https://rdrr.io/r/stats/t.test.html)
  - see workflow: [Two-Group
    Comparison](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/stat-two-group-comparison.html)
- Multi-group comparison (e.g. differential expression) via ANOVA
  - see [`stats::aov()`](https://rdrr.io/r/stats/aov.html)
  - see workflow: [ANOVA Three-Group
    Analysis](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/stat-three-group-analysis-anova.html)
- Binary classification
  - see [`stats::glm()`](https://rdrr.io/r/stats/glm.html)
  - see workflow: [Binary
    Classification](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/stat-binary-classification.html)
- Linear regression
  - see [`stats::lm()`](https://rdrr.io/r/stats/lm.html)
  - see workflow: [Linear
    Regression](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/stat-linear-regression.html)

Note that, in an effort to reduce package size and dependencies, these
articles and workflows are only accessible via the `SomaDataIO`
`pkgdown` website, and are not included with the installed package.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Operating Co., Inc. No license is hereby granted to these trademarks
    other than for purposes of identifying the origin or source of this
    Software.

# Package index

## Load an ADAT

Load RFU (feature) data loaded into (and out of) an R session.

- [`read_adat()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/read_adat.md)
  [`read.adat()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/read_adat.md)
  [`is.soma_adat()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/read_adat.md)
  **\[superseded\]** : Read (Load) SomaLogic ADATs

- [`write_adat()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/write_adat.md)
  : Write an ADAT to File

- [`print(`*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  [`summary(`*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  [`` `[`( ``*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  [`` `$`( ``*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  [`` `[[`( ``*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  [`` `[<-`( ``*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  [`` `$<-`( ``*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  [`` `[[<-`( ``*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  [`median(`*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/soma_adat.md)
  :

  The `soma_adat` Class and S3 Methods

- [`loadAdatsAsList()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/loadAdatsAsList.md)
  [`collapseAdats()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/loadAdatsAsList.md)
  : Load ADAT files as a list

- [`parseHeader()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/parseHeader.md)
  : SomaLogic ADAT parser

- [`rn2col()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/rownames.md)
  [`col2rn()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/rownames.md)
  [`has_rn()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/rownames.md)
  [`rm_rn()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/rownames.md)
  [`set_rn()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/rownames.md)
  [`add_rowid()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/rownames.md)
  : Helpers for Working With Row Names

- [`Col.Meta`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/Col.Meta.md)
  [`colmeta`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/Col.Meta.md)
  [`annotations`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/Col.Meta.md)
  [`rowmeta`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/Col.Meta.md)
  : Analyte Annotations, Col.Meta, and Row Info

- [`is_intact_attr()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/is_intact_attr.md)
  [`is.intact.attributes()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/is_intact_attr.md)
  **\[superseded\]** : Are Attributes Intact?

- [`Math(`*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/groupGenerics.md)
  [`antilog()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/groupGenerics.md)
  [`Ops(`*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/groupGenerics.md)
  [`Summary(`*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/groupGenerics.md)
  [`` `==`( ``*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/groupGenerics.md)
  :

  Group Generics for `soma_adat` Class Objects

- [`reexports`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`count`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`rename`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`slice_sample`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`slice`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`sample_frac`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`sample_n`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`filter`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`mutate`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`arrange`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`group_by`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`ungroup`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`left_join`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`anti_join`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`full_join`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`inner_join`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`semi_join`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`right_join`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`unite`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  [`separate`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/reexports.md)
  : Objects exported from other packages

## ADAT Manipulation

Functions that allow filtering, wrangling, and subset selection of ADAT
objects.

- [`getSeqId()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`regexSeqId()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`locateSeqId()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`seqid2apt()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`apt2seqid()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`is.apt()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`is.SeqId()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`is.AptName()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`matchSeqIds()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  [`getSeqIdMatches()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SeqId.md)
  : Working with SomaLogic SeqIds

- [`is_seqFormat()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/is_seqFormat.md)
  :

  Test `AptName` Format

- [`getAnalyteInfo()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/getAnalyteInfo.md)
  [`getTargetNames()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/getAnalyteInfo.md)
  [`getFeatureData()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/getAnalyteInfo.md)
  : Get Analyte Annotation Information

- [`getAnalytes()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/getAnalytes.md)
  [`getMeta()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/getAnalytes.md)
  [`getFeatures()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/getAnalytes.md)
  : Get Analytes

- [`diffAdats()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/diffAdats.md)
  : Diff Two ADAT Objects

- [`merge_clin()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/merge_clin.md)
  : Merge Clinical Data into SomaScan

- [`preProcessAdat()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/preProcessAdat.md)
  : Pre-Process an ADAT Object for Analysis

- [`updateColMeta()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/updateColMeta.md)
  : Update Col.Meta Attribute to Match Annotations Object

## Transform Between SomaScan Versions

Functionality required to bridge between SomaScan versions, e.g. 11k -\>
7k, sometimes referred to as “lifting”.

- [`lift_adat()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/lift_adat.md)
  [`is_lifted()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/lift_adat.md)
  : Lift an ADAT Between Assay Versions

- [`read_annotations()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/read_annotations.md)
  : Import a SomaLogic Annotations File

- [`transform(`*`<soma_adat>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/transform.md)
  :

  Scale Transform `soma_adat` Columns/Rows

- [`getAdatVersion()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  [`getSomaScanVersion()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  [`getSignalSpace()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  [`checkSomaScanVersion()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  [`getSomaScanLiftCCC()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  : Helpers to Extract Information from an ADAT

## Expression Data

Functions to convert objects to those familiar with `expression` data.

- [`adat2eSet()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat2eSet.md)
  : Convert ADAT to ExpressionSet Object
- [`pivotExpressionSet()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/pivotExpressionSet.md)
  [`meltExpressionSet()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/pivotExpressionSet.md)
  : Convert to Long Format

## Helpers

Accessor functions to add, modify, or retreive attribute information.
Typically used internally but are exported for user convenience.

- [`addAttributes()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/addAttributes.md)
  :

  Add Attributes to `soma_adat` Objects

- [`addClass()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/addClass.md)
  : Add a Class to an Object

- [`cleanNames()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/cleanNames.md)
  : Clean Up Character String

- [`getAdatVersion()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  [`getSomaScanVersion()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  [`getSignalSpace()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  [`checkSomaScanVersion()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  [`getSomaScanLiftCCC()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/adat-helpers.md)
  : Helpers to Extract Information from an ADAT

## Data Summaries

Functions to assist with summarizing SOMAmer RFU values.

- [`calc_eLOD()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/calc_eLOD.md)
  : Calculate Estimated Limit of Detection (eLOD)

## Data Objects

Objects provided with `SomaDataIO`.

- [`SomaScanObjects`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaScanObjects.md)
  [`example_data`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaScanObjects.md)
  [`ex_analytes`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaScanObjects.md)
  [`ex_anno_tbl`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaScanObjects.md)
  [`ex_target_names`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaScanObjects.md)
  [`ex_clin_data`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaScanObjects.md)
  : Example Data and Objects

## Parameters

Common parameter arguments to functions in `SomaDataIO`.

- [`params`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/params.md)
  :

  Common Parameters in SomaDataIO

## Plotting

Functions to assist with plotting information from ADAT objects.

- [`calcOutlierMap()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/calcOutlierMap.md)
  [`print(`*`<outlier_map>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/calcOutlierMap.md)
  : Calculate MAD Outlier Map
- [`getOutlierIds()`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/getOutlierIds.md)
  : Get Flagged Ids From MAD Outlier Map
- [`plot(`*`<Map>`*`)`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/plot.Map.md)
  : Plot Image Maps

## Deprecated

Functions that have been deprecated (sunset) in the current `SomaDataIO`
release.

- [`SomaDataIO-deprecated`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaDataIO-deprecated.md)
  [`getSomamers`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaDataIO-deprecated.md)
  [`getSomamerData`](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/reference/SomaDataIO-deprecated.md)
  **\[superseded\]** :

  Deprecated function(s) of the SomaDataIO package

# Articles

### Loading and Wrangling

- [Loading and Wrangling
  'SomaScan'](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/tips-loading-and-wrangling.md):

  How to load and manipulate a ‘SomaScan’ flat text file into and R
  environment.

- [Safely Map Values via
  dplyr::left_join()](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/tips-safely-map-values.md):

  How to safely and reliably map variable between data frame columns.

- [Safely Rename Data
  Frames](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/tips-safely-rename-df.md):

  How to safely and reliably rename variable names of a data frame (or
  `soma_adat`) in R.

- [Common train-test data
  setups](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/tips-train-test-setup.md):

  Simple code syntax for common machine learning (ML) training vs test
  setups in R.

### Command Line Merge Tool

- [Command Line Merge
  Tool](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/cli-merge-tool.md):

  A convenient CLI merge tool to add new clinical data to ‘SomaScan’
  data.

### Lifting and Bridging

- [Lifting and Bridging
  SomaScan](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/lifting-and-bridging.md):

  A primer on lifting and bridging ‘SomaScan’ data.

### Pre-Processing

- [Pre-Processing
  SomaScan](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/pre-processing.md):

  A primer on pre-processing ‘SomaScan’ data for analysis, including
  filtering samples and features, data QC, and transformations.

### Statistical Workflow Examples

- [Binary
  Classification](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/stat-binary-classification.md):

  Typical binary classification of ‘SomaScan’ data.

- [Linear
  Regression](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/stat-linear-regression.md):

  Typical linear regression of continuous ‘SomaScan’ data.

- [ANOVA Three-Group
  Analysis](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/stat-three-group-analysis-anova.md):

  Typical \> 2-group comparison of ‘SomaScan’ data.

- [Two-Group
  Comparison](https://somalogic.github.io/SomaDataIO/articles/stat-two-group-comparison.md):

  Typical 2-group comparison of ‘SomaScan’ data.
